author: wsjcom
title: It Is Harder to Work Through College Today
text:
Regarding Richard West’s assertion that “You Can’t Work Your Way Through College Anymore” (op-ed, March 17): I have two kids doing just that. My son now works at a paid internship 20 hours a week and takes 18 units at a state school that is affordable. My daughter, a sophomore, followed his template, got a job as a waitress, works 20-plus hours a week and takes classes at a community college. She will transfer to a four-year state school this fall, continue to make good money working very hard (remember we are bumping to a $15 minimum wage) while going to school and through summers.
We...
